intro: Palicourea garciae, commonly known as Garcia's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
